recipes.title: Dumb Sandwich
recipes.description: A cheeky, over-the-top sandwich with crispy bread, melted cheese, and a punchy sauce.
instructions: Butter one side of each bread slice.
Spread mayonnaise and hot sauce on the unbuttered sides.
Add cheese between the slices, buttered sides out.
Toast in a pan over medium heat until golden and melted.

recipes.title: British Carbonara
recipes.description: A British-leaning twist on carbonara with smoky bacon, peas, and a creamy egg sauce.
instructions: Cook spaghetti until al dente, reserving a splash of pasta water.
Fry bacon until crisp, then add peas to warm through.
Whisk eggs and parmesan with black pepper.
Toss pasta with bacon, remove from heat, then stir in egg mixture and a splash of pasta water.
Serve immediately with extra parmesan and pepper.

recipes.title: Classic Chocolate Chip Cookies
recipes.description: Soft, chewy chocolate chip cookies with crispy edges and gooey centers. Perfect for any occasion, these cookies are a timeless favorite that's easy to make and even easier to enjoy.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside.
In a large bowl, beat the softened butter with both sugars until light and fluffy, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the vanilla extract and eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition.
Gradually fold in the flour mixture until just combined. Don't overmix.
Stir in the chocolate chips until evenly distributed.
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets, spacing them 2 inches apart.
Bake for 9-11 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown but centers still look slightly underdone.
Let cookies cool on the baking sheet for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack.
Store in an airtight container for up to 5 days. Enjoy!

recipes.title: Authentic Chinese Egg Fried Rice
recipes.description: A classic Chinese dish with fluffy grains of rice, scrambled eggs, and aromatic spring onions. The secret is using day-old rice and high heat for that perfect wok flavor. Simple, satisfying, and ready in minutes.
instructions: Use day-old refrigerated rice for best results. If using fresh rice, spread it on a tray and refrigerate for 1 hour to dry out.
Beat the eggs in a small bowl with a pinch of salt and white pepper.
Finely slice the spring onions, separating white and green parts.
Heat a wok or large frying pan over high heat until smoking hot. Add 20g of the vegetable oil.
Pour in the beaten eggs and scramble quickly until just set but still slightly wet. Remove and set aside.
Add remaining oil to the wok. Add white parts of spring onions and stir-fry for 30 seconds.
Add the cold rice, breaking up any clumps. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes, tossing constantly to heat through and lightly char.
Return the scrambled eggs to the wok, breaking them into smaller pieces with your spatula.
Add soy sauce around the edge of the wok, then toss everything together for 1 minute.
Add green parts of spring onions and sesame oil. Toss for 30 seconds. Season with white pepper and serve immediately.
